text: {{Infobox writer | name = Ben Bova | image = Ben Bova at Minicon 8(1974).jpg | caption = Ben Bova in 1974 | pseudonym = | birth_name = Benjamin William Bova | birth_date = | birth_place = Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = Naples, Florida, U.S. | occupation = | genre = Science fiction | movement = | notableworks = | awards = Inkpot Award (1985) | website = }} Benjamin William Bova (November 8, 1932November 29, 2020) was an American writer. He was the author of more than 120 works of science fiction. He was a six-time winner of the Hugo Award. He was an editor of Analog Magazine, an editorial director of Omni; he was also president of both the National Space Society and the Science Fiction Writers of America. He was known for his Grand Tour novel series. Bova died on November 29, 2020 at a hospital in Naples, Florida from pneumonia and a stroke caused by COVID-19, aged 88.In Memoriam: Ben Bova, at Science Fiction Writers of America; published November 30, 2020; retrieved November 30, 2020 ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Florida Category:American novelists Category:American science fiction writers Category:American editors Category:American critics Category:American essayists Category:American journalists Category:Writers from Philadelphia
